description: Malians are an infantry and cavalry civilization that excels in economy and technology.
dark_age: Start with 3 villagers, a scout, and a sheep.
Build 1 house, a mill near berries, and a lumber camp near forests.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Use the scout to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 20-21 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 800-1000 food, 150-200 wood, and 150-200 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 4-5 villagers to food, 2-3 to wood, 1-2 to gold, and 3-4 to stone.
feudal_age: Build additional barracks and continue producing infantry units.
Build a market and blacksmith to upgrade infantry and sell excess resources for gold.
Build a stable and start producing scouts and knights.
Advance to Castle Age at around 28-29 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 1500-2000 food, 600-800 wood, 500-600 gold, and 400-500 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 8-10 villagers to food, 5-6 to wood, 3-4 to gold, and 6-7 to stone.
castle_age: Build a university and blacksmith to research and upgrade technologies.
Build a second town center and start training villagers.
Build a siege workshop and start producing siege units.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 36-37 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 3500-4000 food, 2000-2500 wood, 1200-1500 gold, and 1200-1500 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 20-25 villagers to food, 10-12 to wood, 8-10 to gold, and 12-15 to stone.
imperial_age: Research Farimba for improved cavalry performance.
Use siege units to destroy buildings and enemy units.
Research Maghrebi Camels for improved camel performance.
Have around 6000-7000 food, 4000-5000 wood, and 2500-3000 gold and stone in the late Imperial Age.
Assign 40-50 villagers to food, 20-25 to wood, 16-20 to gold, and 25-30 to stone.
